text: Saudi Arabia is in the midst of a
political crisis triggered by several
key things an internal purge
interference in Lebanon and a war in
Yemen here's a look at what's going on
this is Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman
will refer to him by his initials mb/s
he's 32
his dad is King Salman ruler of Saudi
Arabia so what's happened on November
4th MBs oversaw the arrests of several
royal family members and ministers as
part of a so-called corruption crackdown
critics said the apparent purge was a
move to consolidate power but the scale
and speed of it raised eyebrows one
theory is the king may be ill or growing
senile and MBS has been acting fast to
eliminate rivals to the throne now let's
move to Lebanon as this purge is
happening in Saudi Arabia
Lebanon's prime minister Saud al Hariri
unexpectedly resigns Hariri pops up on
Saudi TV in Riyadh saying his life was
threatened by Hezbollah the iran-backed
group that he shares power with back
home mr. mayor - Hariri is Saudi
Arabia's man in Lebanon he is Saudi
citizenship and financial ties with the
country so MBS has some degree of
leverage over him so many think
Lebanon's leader is being held in Riyadh
against his will and has been pressured
to tow Saudis anti-iran line in front of
the cameras and then there's Yemen while
all this is going on Saudi is already
mired in a war against allies of Iran
here so what's really going on here are
two possible answers domestically MBS is
trying to shore up his popularity at
home by playing hardball with
well-heeled Royals who much of Saudis
public already perceive as being corrupt
in turn he's promised a mostly young
unemployed population that he will
modernize and liberalize the country
regionally MBS wants to take on Iran
which rivals for regional influence and
has been steadily gaining dominance
particularly since the 2003 invasion of
Iraq upset the Power Balance in the
region but a young untested crown prince
pursuing an internal purge while
simultaneously tampering with the
politics of another country in order to
bethe Ron is a high risk strategy in a
region already in so much turmoil
you
